questions.question: Which statement best summarizes Newton's 3rd Law of Motion?

choices.answer: forces always act in unequal, same-direction pairs
forces act in pairs of unequal and opposite reactions
forces always act in equal & opposite, action-reaction pairs
forces always act alone

questions.question: T/F: While the Earth's gravity pulls us downward, we also pull upwards on the Earth.

choices.answer: TRUE
FALSE

questions.question: If an astronaut slowly drifts away from the ISS, how might she be able to move back towards it?

choices.answer: by throwing something heavy away from the ISS
by throwing something heavy towards the ISS
by moving her arms as though she were swimming
by staying in one place and letting gravity pull her back

questions.question: Why wouldn't that same astronaut be able to get back to the ISS by using a swimming motion?

choices.answer: it would cause her to drift farther away
the air in space is too dense to move through
there is no air to resist her motion and propel her forward
there is not enough gravity present

questions.question: T/F: When you push a cart, the cart applies an equal and opposite force on you.

choices.answer: TRUE
FALSE

questions.question: Why are you able to accelerate forwards when starting to walk?

choices.answer: there's an equal & opposite force between your two feet
your body leans forward creating momentum
ground creates an equal & opposite force against your foot
no acceleration occurs when you walk

questions.question: T/F: The windshield of a moving car has an equal & opposite force to a bug that smashes into it

choices.answer: TRUE
FALSE

questions.question: If the bug & windshield apply equal & opposite forces, then why does the bug smash into it?

choices.answer: the car's acceleration is greater than the bug's mass
the car's acceleration is less than the bug's mass
there is a lack of air resistance
the windshield actually had a greater force

questions.question: In a game of tug-o-war, what's the equal & opposite force to Team A pulling right on the rope?

choices.answer: the force of friction between the ground and their shoes
Team B's hands pulling left on the rope
the force of the rope against Team B's hands
the rope's opposite force pulling on Team A's hands

questions.question: Newton's 3rd Law states that if a baseball pushes a bat inward, then that bat would ______.

choices.answer: be unable to push back
push the baseball outward
continue to push inward
break due to the force of friction

questions.question: If a balloon pushes air molecules inward, then Newton's 3rd Law states that ________.

choices.answer: the air molecules would lose mass
the balloon would lose all its air
the air particles would push outward on the balloon
the number of air particles would decrease

questions.question: If a player kicks a soccer ball to the left, what would be the equal and opposite reaction?

choices.answer: the soccer ball would move upwards in the air
the ground would push upwards on the player's foot
gravity would pull the ball downwards
the soccer ball would push right on the player's foot

questions.question: A boy sits on a chair with 5N of force, how many Newton's of force does the chair have on him?

choices.answer: 2 N
5 N
the chair has no force on the boy

questions.question: T/F: In order for an object to have its own gravitational force, it must have a mass > 20kg.

choices.answer: TRUE
FALSE

questions.question: Why was #14 False? (An object's mass must be > 20kg to have gravitational force).

choices.answer: An object's mass must be less than 20 kg
An object's mass must be greater than 100 kg
its mass does not matter, only its velocity matters
any amount of mass will give an object gravitational force
